= Introduction =

[http://i219.photobucket.com/albums/cc244/leonardoaraujo/80186_arch.png]

The 8086 is a 16-bit processor divided in three parts (BIU,EU,AU) it has 20-bit address bus capable of addressing 1Mb of memory divided in cells of one byte.


= Details =

http://i219.photobucket.com/albums/cc244/leonardoaraujo/Diagrama_Blocos_3.png

8086 main parts
  * BIU(Bus Interface Unit): Sends address asked by AU to the address bus.
  * EU(Executing Unit): Tell AU where to get instructions or data(fetch) , decode, execute
  * AU(Addressing Unit): Create an full 20-bit address from Segment and Offset
